metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4870 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL Server 5.5.45 and earlier, and5.6.26 and earlier, allows remote authenticated users to affectavailability via unknown vectors related to Server : Parser.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4870` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mariadb-client - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-common - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-connect-engine-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-oqgraph-engine-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-test - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-test-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.22-0ubuntu1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
